sentences.english: In the world of today, absolute majority countries have parties and exercise party politics.
sentences.chinese: 當今世界，絕大多數國家都存在政黨，實行政黨政治。

sentences.english: In the world of today, absolute majority countries have parties and exercise party politics.
sentences.chinese: 當今世界，絕大多數國家都存在政黨，實行政黨政治。

sentences.english: And, yes, I mean one of our parties.
sentences.chinese: 還有，沒錯，我說的是政黨之一。

sentences.english: Inter-party forum calls for global reform .
sentences.chinese: 中歐政黨高層論壇呼喚全球改革。

sentences.english: Police stations and offices of the ruling National Democratic Party were on fire across the country.
sentences.chinese: 全國各地的警局和執政黨黨部被焚燒。

sentences.english: He has spoken out strongly against an election won by Taiwan's pro-independence party.
sentences.chinese: 他曾強烈抗議臺灣贏得選舉的親獨立政黨。

sentences.english: The improvement of the work style of the party in power means its life and death.
sentences.chinese: ⑴執政黨的黨風建設關係到它的生死存亡。

sentences.english: There are about a dozen political parties in America， only two of which are major parties.
sentences.chinese: 美國有十幾個政黨，其中只有兩個黨是主要黨。

sentences.english: These two party names originated with the Glorious Revolution(1688).
sentences.chinese: 這兩個政黨名稱皆起源於1688年的光榮革命。

sentences.english: He understands that the days are gone when the party can maintain political stability with the muzzle of a gun.
sentences.chinese: 他知道一個政黨靠槍桿子出政權的日子一去不復返了。

sentences.english: Have faith, Mr. Reagan asked his party and his country.
sentences.chinese: 里根對他的政黨和國家的要求是堅守信念。

sentences.english: And a big theme for European far-right parties is Muslim-bashing.
sentences.chinese: 並且歐洲極右政黨的一個重大議題便是痛擊穆斯林。

sentences.english: People visit www.qieWO.comtheir families and arrange some of the most lavish parties.
sentences.chinese: 人們參觀他們的家庭和安排一些最奢華的政黨。

sentences.english: The ultimate aim of their political party is to rebuild the society.
sentences.chinese: 他們政黨的最終目標是改造社會。

sentences.english: But why media & opp. parties are silent on this very serious issue?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼各媒體和政黨對如此嚴重的問題保持沉默？

sentences.english: The party is likely to split in half.
sentences.chinese: 這個政黨可能分分裂成兩派。

definition: DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
group of people/camp/faction/sides in a dispute
within the party (esp. Chinese communist party)
